radiographic_examinations.findings: No obvious lesions in the brain.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: First scan showed a small hypodensity in the right periventricular white matter; subsequent scans showed a progression of abnormalities with increasing nonspecific hypodensities in the subcortical white matter bilaterally.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple hyperintense lesions on T2-weighted and fluid-attenuated inversion recovery images, involving the left cerebellar hemisphere, middle cerebellar peduncle, midline cerebellum, subcortical white matter bilaterally, and parietal white-matter regions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: A repeated MRI showed resolution of some lesions and a decrease in the size of others.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Evidence of evolving new infarcts of the right frontal lobe with new juxtacortical and subcortical lesions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Multiple progressive ischemic lesions in the brain were confirmed.
